oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from United Mine Workers of America President W.M. Turnblazer to Gov. Gordon Browning regarding labor conference
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from United Mine Workers of America President W.M. Turnblazer to Gov. Gordon Browning regarding his appointment to represent Tennessee at a national labor conference. Turnblazer references Hitler and Mussolini when describing the dictatorial attitudes of some unnamed parties.

In July of 1935, Congress enacted the National Labor Relations Act to protect the rights of American employees and employers. The NLRA allowed employees to form unions and participate in collective bargaining.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Turnblazer, W.M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United Mine Workers of America; New Deal, 1933-1939--Tennessee
